SEARCH
Package org.example.gui.component.account

Class CreateAccount

java.lang.Object
org.example.gui.component.account.CreateAccount
public class CreateAccount extends Object
A class responsible for creating user accounts. It performs various checks such as ensuring that the username and email are unique and validating the format of the username.

    Enum representing the status of account creation.

  • Field Details

    • users

      private List<User> users
      A list of existing users, which is used to check if a username or email is already taken.

  • Constructor Details

    • CreateAccount

      public CreateAccount()
      Constructs a new CreateAccount instance. This constructor reads the list of users from a JSON file to check against existing accounts.

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public CreateAccount.AccountCreationStatus createAccount(String username, String password, String email, String firstName, String lastName)
      Creates a new user account. It checks if the username and email are unique and if the username format is correct. If all validations pass, a new User object is created and added to the list of users.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for the new account.
      password - The password for the new account.
      email - The email for the new account.
      firstName - The first name of the new user.
      lastName - The last name of the new user.
      Returns:
      The status of the account creation process.

    • isUsernameTaken

      private boolean isUsernameTaken(String username)
      Checks if a given username is already taken by an existing user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to check.
      Returns:
      true if the username is taken, false otherwise.

    • isEmailTaken

      private boolean isEmailTaken(String email)
      Checks if a given email is already taken by an existing user.
      Parameters:
      email - The email to check.
      Returns:
      true if the email is taken, false otherwise.

    • isUsernameFormatCorrect

      private boolean isUsernameFormatCorrect(String username)
      Validates the format of the username. The username is considered incorrect if it contains spaces.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the username format is incorrect (contains spaces), false otherwise.
